meanings.definition: Omit or neglect to do something.
meanings.sent1: I pretermit my homework sometimes, but I try to finish it later.
meanings.sent2: Please do not pretermit your responsibilities at work.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard would pretermit his spells, causing chaos in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would pretermit the worries of the day as she danced under the stars.
meanings.sent5: If you pretermit your daily exercise, you may not feel as healthy.

meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the boss would pretermit my suggestions.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to pretermit someone's feelings when making decisions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat would pretermit the 'Do Not Enter' sign and sneak into the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist's eyes would pretermit the flaws in the painting, focusing only on its beauty.
meanings.sent5: If you pretermit the warning signs, you may face consequences.

meanings.sent1: She would pretermit her daily chores and relax instead.
meanings.sent2: Do not pretermit any important details when writing your report.
meanings.sent3: The chef would pretermit the salt in the recipe, resulting in a bland dish.
meanings.sent4: The author decided to pretermit the final chapter of the book, leaving readers in suspense.
meanings.sent5: If you pretermit the key steps in the process, you may not achieve the desired outcome.
